intro: Ancistrocladus robertsoniorum, commonly known as the Robertson's ancistrocladus, is a rare shrub native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Ancistrocladaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain elliptical seeds. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in dry, woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
